alert.note: Alert for Morton; Stanton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 28 at 7:00PM CDT until May 28 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MORTON...SOUTHWESTERN GRANT...STEVENS AND SOUTHEASTERN STANTON COUNTIES... At 659 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles west of Moscow to 8 miles northwest of Hooker, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Hugoton, Moscow, Woods and Feterita. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
